tit.cmt: 用語集に複数登録有り（Oharida no miya Imperial residence）
Oharida no Miyaに訂正しました

sen.j: 小墾田宮（おはりだのみや）は古代日本、推古朝の宮殿。
sen.e: Oharida Palace is a palace built during the Reign of the Empress Suiko in ancient Japan.
Oharida no Miya Palace is a palace built during the Reign of the Empress Suiko in ancient Japan.
sen.cmt: Oharida no Miyaに訂正しました
sen.e: Oharida no Miya Palace is a palace built during the Reign of the Empress Suiko in ancient Japan.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.e: It is usually written as"小墾田宮" but also written as "小治田宮" in Chinese character.
sen.cmt: 漢字の説明なので、「普通漢字では『小墾田宮』と書くが」を加えて訳しています
sen.e: It is usually written as"小墾田宮" but also written as "小治田宮" in Chinese character.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: It is usually written as"小墾田宮" but also written as "小治田宮" in Chinese character.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 日本書紀によると603年（推古11）、豊浦宮（とゆらのみや）で推古天皇は即位した。
sen.e: According to the Nihon Shoki (the Chronicle of Japan,) the Empress Suiko ascended the throne at Toyura Palace in 603.
sen.cmt: Toyura no miya Imperial residence一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: According to the Nihon Shoki (the Chronicle of Japan), the Empress Suiko ascended the throne at Toyura Palace in 603.
sen.cmt: コンマの位置を訂正しました。
sen.e: According to the Nihon Shoki (the Chronicle of Japan), the Empress Suiko ascended the throne at Toyura Palace in 603.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 推古天皇は新宮として小墾田宮を造営しここに居を移したという。
sen.e: It is said that she built a new residence, Oharida Palace, to move in then.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is said that she built a new residence, Oharida no Miya Palace, to move in then.
sen.cmt: Oharida no Miyaに訂正しました
sen.e: It is said that she built a new residence, Oharida no Miya Palace, to move in then.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 国家権力の中心地として築造し、遷宮したと考えられる。
sen.e: Presumably, Oharida Palace was built to be the new center of the state authority.
Presumably, Oharida no Miya Palace was built to be the new center of the state authority.
sen.cmt: Oharida no Miyaに訂正しました
sen.e: Presumably, Oharida no Miya Palace was built to be the new center of the state authority.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: その後女帝死去するまでの間に、蘇我氏、聖徳太子らを中心として、冠位十二階の制定、十七条憲法の制定、遣隋使派遣などの重要施策がこの宮で行われた。
sen.e: Important measures, such as establishing Kan I junikai (twelve grades of cap rank) or the Seventeen Article Constitution, as well as sending a Japanese envoy to Tang Dynasty China, were implemented here by the Soga clan and Prince Shotoku until the death of the empress.

sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Important measures, such as establishing Kan I junikai (twelve grades of cap rank) or the Seventeen Article Constitution, as well as sending a Japanese envoy to Tang Dynasty China, were implemented here by the Soga clan and Prince Shotoku until the death of the empress.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 日本書紀の記述からこの宮の構造は、南に「南門」を構えその北に諸大夫の勤する「庁」が並ぶ「朝庭」が広がっていたと推測される。
sen.e: Based on the description of the Nihon Shoki, the palace is estimated to have had the "south gate" and the "Imperial Court" with several "cho" agencies Shodaibu (lower aristocracy) worked for, on the north side of the gate.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Based on the description of the Nihon Shoki, the palace is estimated to have had the 'south gate' and the 'Imperial Court' with several 'cho' agencies Shodaibu (lower aristocracy) worked for, on the north side of the gate.
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合せて"を'に訂正しました。
sen.e: Based on the description of the Nihon Shoki, the palace is estimated to have had the 'south gate' and the 'Imperial Court' with several 'cho' agencies Shodaibu (lower aristocracy) worked for, on the north side of the gate.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: そのさらに北の大門を入ると女帝の住まう「大殿」が営まれていたことが推定される。
sen.e: It is also estimated that further north was Daimon-gate and "Otono" where the empress used to live.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is also estimated that further north was Daimon-gate and 'Otono' where the empress used to live.

sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: これは後代の宮城において、朝堂院と大極殿および内裏に発展するものの原型と思われる。
sen.e: This structure of a palace later developed into a palace consisting of Chodo-in (office in palace), Daigokuden (council hall in palace), and Dairi (Imperial residence.)
This structure of a palace later developed into a palace consisting of Chodo-in (office in palace), Daigokuden (council hall in palace), and Dairi (Imperial residence).
sen.cmt: ピリオドの位置を訂正しました。

sen.j: 小墾田宮の所在地については奈良県高市郡明日香村豊浦（とようら）に「古宮」という小字があることから、以前より有力地とされていた。
sen.e: As for the location of Oharida Palace, Toyoura (Asuka Village, Takaichi County, Nara Prefecture) had been the leading candidate for long because there is a koaza (small administrative unit of a village) named "Furumiya" there.

sen.j: 1970年（昭和45）～1973年（昭和48）の発掘調査では宮殿跡は見つからなかった.
sen.e: During the research and excavation between 1970 and 1973, remains of Oharida Palace was not found.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: During the research and excavation between 1970 and 1973, remains of Oharida no Miya Palace was not found.
sen.cmt: Oharida no Miyaに訂正しました
sen.e: During the research and excavation between 1970 and 1973, remains of Oharida no Miya Palace was not found.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: だが、掘立柱建物群、庭園（苑地）などの遺構が見つかった。
sen.e: However structural remnants of several dug-standing pillar buildings and gardens were found.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However structural remnants of several dug-standing pillar buildings and gardens were found.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: だが、1987年（昭和62）には明日香村雷（いかずち）近辺の「雷丘東方遺跡」で「小治田」と墨書された土器破片が見つかった。
sen.e: In Ikazuchi no Oka Toho site around Ikazuchi, Asuka Village, an earthenware fragment with ink inscription of "Oharida" was found in 1987.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 'Ikazuchi no Oka Toho site' around Ikazuchi, Asuka Village, an earthenware fragment with ink inscription of 'Oharida' was found in 1987.
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合せて"を'に訂正しました。
sen.e: In 'Ikazuchi no Oka Toho site' around Ikazuchi, Asuka Village, an earthenware fragment with ink inscription of 'Oharida' was found in 1987.

sen.j: このことで、こちらが俄然有力な候補地として注目されるようになっている。
sen.e: Thus Ikazuchi no Oka Toho site suddenly began to attract attention as a stronger candidate.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Thus Ikazuchi no Oka Toho site suddenly began to attract attention as a stronger candidate.

sen.j: よって、この遺跡を「小墾田宮推定地」と呼ぶ。
sen.e: Ikazuchi no Oka Toho site is, therefore, called as "potential Oharida Palace."
